messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] KATANA, KANESADA
messages.msgSnippet: Hello Darcy, Thank you for that.  There are pictures under Nihonto photo album TZ KAN & under the NINONTO STUDY Photo albums they are under Kanasada.  Let
messages.messageBody:
Hello Darcy,
Thank you for that. There are pictures under Nihonto photo album "TZ KAN" & under the NINONTO STUDY Photo albums they are under "Kanasada." Let me know if you can get to them alright and please give mye your input, very much appreciated.
Tom

samurai@... wrote:

Hi Tom,

I've owned two by Nidai Kanesada. If you send me your pictures I will
let you know it compares.

- darcy

<tzogar@...> writes:

> Gentlefolk,

> I have gathered some data from some of our forum mumbers over the
> past week or so. I just found this study group and joined up and
> while I am sure that everyone who was kind enough to already help me
> belongs to this group I was hoping that perhaps some additional
> input might be derived from within this membership.

> I have put together a small group of pictures of a sword that I
> frankly am unqualified to provide an opinion or an valuation of.
> The mune is about 1/4" wide for about 7' then tapers down to about
> 1/8th". The shinogi in the tapered area appears to be wider than
> that however. I would appreciate any information one could possibly
> provide to me.
> Regards
> Tom

messages.subject: KATANA, KANESADA
messages.msgSnippet: Gentlefolk, I have gathered some data from some of our forum mumbers over the past week or so. I just found this study group and joined up and while I am sure
messages.messageBody:
Gentlefolk,

I have gathered some data from some of our forum mumbers over the
past week or so. I just found this study group and joined up and
while I am sure that everyone who was kind enough to already help me
belongs to this group I was hoping that perhaps some additional
input might be derived from within this membership.

I have put together a small group of pictures of a sword that I
frankly am unqualified to provide an opinion or an valuation of.
The mune is about 1/4" wide for about 7' then tapers down to about
1/8th". The shinogi in the tapered area appears to be wider than
that however. I would appreciate any information one could possibly
provide to me.
Regards
Tom
